flow.descriptionCdata:
d1abf416-26a5-4676-99e5-41ab7a256d7a.03abdfc9-3fbd-40a5-b637-12994371705d.description=This workflow returns the component properties and values using Artifact APIs. result\: propertyNameValuesList\: pipe separated list of property name and values ( where each property name and values would be ; seprated and multiple values would be , seprated) e.g. - property 1; value1,value2|property 2; value3|property 3; value3,value4|........ d1abf416-26a5-4676-99e5-41ab7a256d7a.0484e085-a06e-4a03-afda-cb4945aba2f1.prompt=Process Instance ID d1abf416-26a5-4676-99e5-41ab7a256d7a.34479a97-e5f8-400a-a8e6-cad4eeb1a6dd.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State d1abf416-26a5-4676-99e5-41ab7a256d7a.3dbeb03b-487f-4397-aaed-49e044f0c9f7.prompt=Process Instance ID d1abf416-26a5-4676-99e5-41ab7a256d7a.5863302d-ff3b-48cd-ba10-b011593ba6ea.prompt=User Identifier d1abf416-26a5-4676-99e5-41ab7a256d7a.5bae22e5-9675-4b8c-88a0-7330fdc77f8d.prompt=User Identifier d1abf416-26a5-4676-99e5-41ab7a256d7a.7cd2ae64-e625-474a-a26b-86a19689ae53.prompt=Artifact ID d1abf416-26a5-4676-99e5-41ab7a256d7a.94690d49-3d8d-4fcc-a2e2-b1a16d244e2b.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State d1abf416-26a5-4676-99e5-41ab7a256d7a.96007c23-f4b1-4760-b0eb-a5f12002546c.prompt=User Identifier d1abf416-26a5-4676-99e5-41ab7a256d7a.d0e1a413-0b94-4522-b70f-5a219f00f508.description=
Sends an smtp email
 
Input Parameters\:
hostname - hostname or ip address of smtp server
port - port smtp service is listening
from - from email address
to - email address(s) or recipients
subject - email subject
body - body of the email
htmlEmail - true or false, whether the email should be sent supporting html rich email.
readReceipt - true or false, whether or not to request a read receipt
attachments - comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path)
username - if SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send
password - the password to use
characterSet - the character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8
contentTransferEncoding - the content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
 
 Responses\:
 success - successfully sent the email
 failure - failed to send the email

Note\:
For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
	For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
d1abf416-26a5-4676-99e5-41ab7a256d7a.dba1d6a4-b7bf-4fe7-b9bd-825c1443ce27.prompt=User Identifier d1abf416-26a5-4676-99e5-41ab7a256d7a.f31ac1f1-4844-4bf1-a8e4-dd82667c1dab.prompt=Resource Provider ID d1abf416-26a5-4676-99e5-41ab7a256d7a.f362f61b-35b2-485f-ad8f-5260ba84de31.description=
Sends an smtp email
 
Input Parameters\:
hostname - hostname or ip address of smtp server
port - port smtp service is listening
from - from email address
to - email address(s) or recipients
subject - email subject
body - body of the email
htmlEmail - true or false, whether the email should be sent supporting html rich email.
readReceipt - true or false, whether or not to request a read receipt
attachments - comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path)
username - if SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send
password - the password to use
characterSet - the character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8
contentTransferEncoding - the content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
 
 Responses\:
 success - successfully sent the email
 failure - failed to send the email

Note\:
For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
	For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
flow.name: VPC - Restore Snapshot

step.name: Send Mail to Support to Restore Snapshot

staticBinding.value:
Please restore the snapshot for MTC server ${Hostname}.

When completed, please respond to the requestor notifying them.
Requestor Email: ${server.email}

Your MTC request to restore a snapshot of the below server has been received.



Hostname: ${server.name}
Public IP: ${server.publicIP}
CSA ID: ${SVC_SUBSCRIPTION_ID}

Please allow up to 3 business days for this task to be completed.



Regards,
The MTC Support Team
